sentences.sentence: The Cat and the Mice
A house was full of mice.
A cat went into the house and began to catch and eat them one by one.
The mice then hid away( 躲藏 ) in their holes.
The cat couldn’t catch them anymore, so she thought of a way to get them to come out.
To do this she pretended( 假装 ) to be dead.
When the mice came near, she jumped up and caught many of them.
Pleased with the success of this, she tried another plan.
She covered herself with flour( 面粉 ), and lay on some flour( 面粉 ) bags, as if she were one of them.
The young mice got close to her, but an old mouse said,
“I have seen many bags in my day, but never one with a cat’s head. Even if you turn into a real flour( 面粉 ) bag, I will not come near you.”
MORAL: Don’t be tricked( 欺骗 ) twice by the same person.
The Cat-Maiden( 少女 )
The gods were once arguing whether it was possible for a living thing to change its nature.
Zeus said, “Yes,” but Aphrodite said, “No.”
So, to test this, Zeus turned a cat into a girl, and gave her to a young man for a wife.
The wedding happened and the young couple sat down to the wedding meal.
“See,” said Zeus, to Aphrodite, “how well she behaves( 表现 ). Who could tell that yesterday she was a cat? Surely her nature is changed?”
“Wait a minute,” replied Aphrodite, and let a mouse loose( 释放 ) into the room.
When the bride( 新娘 ) saw this, she jumped up and tried to catch the mouse.
“Ah, you see,” said Aphrodite, “true nature will come out.”
MORAL: Try as you may, it is impossible to deny( 否认 ) your nature.
The Cows and the Butchers( 屠夫 )
The cows once decided to kill the butchers( 屠夫 ), whose job was to kill them.
They got together one day, and prepared to fight.
One of the oldest then said, “It is true that these butchers( 屠夫 ) kill us, but they do that with skillful hands, and give us little pain.
If we kill them all, we'll suffer( 遭受 ) more under unskillful( 不熟练的 ) hands. You can be sure that even if all the butchers( 屠夫 ) die, men will still want beef.”
MORAL: Better the evil you know than the one you don’t know.
The Crab( 螃蟹 ) and Its Mother
A crab( 螃蟹 ) said to her son, “Why do you walk sideways( 侧着 ), my child? It is much better to walk straight forward.”
The young crab( 螃蟹 ) replied, “True, dear mother. If you will show me how to do it, I will try to do that too.”
The mother tried to walk straight, but couldn’t do it.
MORAL: It’s better to teach than simply to tell.
The Crow( 乌鸦 ) and the Water Bottle
A very thirsty crow( 乌鸦 ) saw a water bottle and flew to it, hoping to find water inside.
He realized that there was too little water for him to reach to drink.
He tried everything he could to reach the water, but failed.
At last, he collected as many stones as he could carry, and dropped them one by one into the bottle, until the water level was high enough for him to drink.
MORAL: Necessity is the mother of invention.

question.cn: 在故事The Cat and the Mouse中，猫捉老鼠的计划是什么？
question.en: In the story the Cat and the Mouse, what was the cat's plan to catch the mouse?

options.en: She hid herself in the dark.
She disguised herself as a flour bag.

analysis: 文中提到：“She covered herself with flour, and lay on some flour bags, as if she were one of them.”因此选C。

question.cn: 在故事The Cat-Maiden中，Aphrodite用什么方法测试新娘？
question.en: In the story the Cat-Maiden, how did Aphrodite test the bride?

options.cn: 她把猫变成了一个绅士。
options.en: She turned the cat into a gentleman.
She gave the bride some fish.

analysis: 文中提到：“‘Wait a minute,’replied Aphrodite, and let a mouse loose into the room.” Aphrodite说等一下，然后在房间里释放了一只老鼠，因此选C。

question.cn: 在故事The Cows and the Butchers中，为什么牛想杀死屠夫们？
question.en: In the story the Cows and the Butchers, why did the cows decide to kill the butchers?

options.cn: 他们的王被一个屠夫杀死了。
options.en: Their king was killed by a butcher.
The butchers’ job was to kill them.

options.cn: 屠夫们用很残忍的方法杀牛。
options.en: The butchers killed them in horrible ways.

analysis: 文中提到：“The cows once decided to kill the butchers, whose job was to kill them.” 屠夫的工作是杀牛，所以牛想要杀死屠夫，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Crab and Its Mother 中，螃蟹的妈妈能否向前走？
question.en: In the story the Crab and Its Mother, was the crab mother able to walk straight forward？

analysis: 文中提到：“The mother tried to walk straight, but couldn't do it.”可知，螃蟹妈妈也不能向前走，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Crow and the Water Bottle中，为了喝到瓶子里的水，乌鸦做了什么？
question.en: In the story the Crow and the Water Bottle, what did the crow do in order to drink water?

options.cn: 他让另一只乌鸦帮助他。
options.en: He asked another crow to help him.
He dropped some stones into the bottle.

analysis: 文中提到：“He collected as many stones as he could carry, and dropped them one by one into the bottle, until the water level was high enough.”乌鸦把收集的石头扔进瓶子里使其水位上升，因此选C。
